alert.note: Alert for Coastal Broward County; Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Broward County through 345 PM EDT... At 315 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Intersection I-75 And Griffin Road, or near Pembroke Pines, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Lauderdale, Pembroke Pines, Hollywood, Miramar, Coral Springs, Pompano Beach, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Deerfield Beach, Tamarac, Margate, Lighthouse Point, Lauderdale-By-The-Sea, Lauderhill, Weston, Coconut Creek, Oakland Park, North Lauderdale and Lauderdale Lakes. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Broward County; Inland Broward County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metro Broward County; Metropolitan Miami Dade
